channel.title: Raleigh NC Parks and Recreation News
channel.description: Latest news from Raleigh Parks and Recreation

item.title: 2026 Summer Concert Series (Feb 18, 2026)
item.description:
Each summer, local artists donate their talent and time to put on a great free show for the community. On select Sundays from now until Aug. 16, we will host groups performing a variety of different genres that will help set the tone for an awesome evening at these two beautiful facilities. 



May 31 - SWAG
June 7 - Blue Notes Jazz Band
June 14 - Carpe Diem Saxophone Quartet 
Aug. 2 - The Holly Springs Community Band
Aug. 9 - Triangle Sax Ensemble



Aug. 16  - Bull City Trio



Sunday Evenings
Time: 6 - 8 p.m.
Ages: All
Cost: Free

item.title: Little Leprechaun (Feb 18, 2026)
item.description:
Calling all the little leprechauns, one and all! We are going to have a sham-ROCK of a good time creating crafts and reading stories to celebrate this fun holiday! Hope to see you soon! Pre-Registration is required.



Location: Hill Street Park
Date: Monday, March 16
Time: 3:30 - 4:30 p.m.
Ages: 2-5
Cost: $8 per participant
Register on RecLink

item.title: True Crime Trivia (Feb 9, 2026)
item.description:
Challenge your knowledge of real-life mysteries, puzzling cases, and surprising facts. Whether you are a seasoned detective or just love a good story, this night will be packed
with friendly competitions, fun laughs, and OH MY GOSH moments!



Location: Jaycee Community Center
Date: Tuesday, May 5
Time: 5:30 - 7:30 p.m.
Ages: 18 and older
Cost: $8
*You will, as one person, register for your team. Each team can have 3-5 members.
Registration coming soon!

item.title: Valentines Speed-Friending (Feb 9, 2026)
item.description:
Have you been looking for a gym partner? Maybe someone to share book recommendations with? 



This event will be a way to connect with other folks looking to make friendships! We will provide fun activities, treats, and conversation starters aimed at building community and starting new friendships.

Location: Five Points Center for Active Adults
Date: Thursday, Feb. 12
Time: 3 - 5 p.m.

item.title: A New Nash: Kick-Off Party & Open House (Feb 2, 2026)
item.description:
Historic Nash Square is one of our Capital City’s original public open spaces!



Join us as we kick off the Nash Square Public Realm Plan to learn about its past and present, and to help shape its future. Raleigh Parks is excited to create a New Nash that reflects the unique needs and desires of the community. We welcome your input and look forward to collaborating with you!



This event is family-friendly and will include activities for people of all ages. Accommodations and translation services are available upon request. Please contact nashsquare@publicinput.com for requests and assistance.  



Learn more & participate in the planning process!



Location: Whiskey Kitchen (201 W. Martin Street, Raleigh, NC 27601)
Date: Thursday, Feb. 26 
Time: 5:30 - 8 p.m.
Ages: All
Cost: Free

item.title: Read and Go Trip - It Dies With You (Feb 2, 2026)
item.description:
Join Scott Blackburn, author of It Dies With You, as he takes us on a journey to the locations throughout the book. The story takes place in Flint Creek, NC, which is a fictional location, but the places are based on locations in Greensboro and Kernersville, NC.



After a post-fight brawl jeopardizes his boxing career, Hudson Miller takes a job as a bar bouncer, only to be hit with worse news: his estranged father has been murdered. Upon returning to settle the estate and discovering he’s inheriting his father’s salvage yard. But Miller’s Pull-a-Part hides more than scrap metal. The property was a front for an illegal gun-running operation, and a gruesome discovery there pulls Hudson into a deadly mystery.



Departs from the Anne Gordon Active Adult Center
(1901 Spring Forest Road, Raleigh, NC 27615)
Date: Tuesday, March 3
Time: 8:45 a.m. to 4 p.m.
Cost: $35/Residents, $50/Non-residents
Register on RecLink
You must register for the Active Adult Yearly Trip Registration before you can register for any trips. 



Register by calling one of the Active Adult Centers: 



For trip questions and/or registration, contact Carmen Rayfield at 919-996-4734 or carmen.rayfield@raleighnc.gov



Visit our website to learn more about our day and multi-day travel opportunities.

item.title: Enjoy an Unforgettable Afternoon of Dining and the Musical Bright Star! (Feb 2, 2026)
item.description:
The show is set in the American South in the 1920s and 1940s. When Alice Murphy meets a young soldier just home from World War II, he awakens her longing for the child she once lost. Haunted by their unique connection, Alice sets out on a journey to understand her past, and what she finds has the power to transform both of their lives. Additional Trip Information



The trip departs from the Anne Gordon Active Adult Center
(1901 Spring Forest Road, Raleigh, NC 27615)
Date: Sunday, April 26
Time: 10:30 a.m. to 5 p.m.
Cost: Residents $53/Non-Residents $68 (Lunch on your own)
Register on RecLink
You must register for the Active Adult Yearly Trip Registration before you can register for any trips. 



Register by calling one of the Active Adult Centers: 



For trip questions and/or registration, contact Carmen Rayfield at 919-996-4734 or carmen.rayfield@raleighnc.gov



Visit our website to learn more about our day and multi-day travel opportunities.

item.description:
Paper, ribbons, stickers, lace, and more will be provided. Each person can make up to 5 Valentines. This is a drop-in event for all ages, and adults are welcome!



Light snacks will be available, or you may bring your own dinner. Please let staff know at least 2 days in advance if your participant has allergies or special dietary concerns. Please register on RecLink so we can plan accordingly.

item.title: Away with the Fairies (Feb 17, 2026)
item.description:
Enter a market full of fairies, dragons, mischief, and more at this themed event. Set in Mordecai Historic Park's beautiful nature space, Paper & Stars Studio has gathered local makers, food vendors, and independent businesses to bring together the best of what Raleigh has to offer. 

Enjoy free crafts and activities, find the perfect handmade treasures, and celebrate Spring - all while enjoying great food and fun. New this year, make your own fairy or dragon garden to take home!  Don’t forget to wear your best fairy or fantasy attire!  



Please learn more and apply here
A Wonderstruck Children's Festival by Paper & Stars Studio



Location: Mordecai Historic Park
Date: Saturday, March 21
Time: 10 a.m. - 2 p.m.
Ages: All
Cost: Free

item.description:

Bring a blanket, gather your friends and family, and enjoy great food in the heart of the park all season long.



Date: Fridays starting May 1 - Aug. 28
Time: 6 - 9 p.m.
Ages: All

item.description:

Date: Saturday, March 15
Time: 2 - 3:30 p.m.
Ages: 14 and older

Register on RecLink

item.title: Raleigh Parks Expands Community Wellness Vision (Feb 16, 2026)
item.description:
Raleigh Parks, Recreation and Cultural Resources is inviting residents to help shape the next chapter of Glen Eden Pilot Park by attending a series of community open houses this spring.



The Health & Wellness team is working to reimagine Glen Eden Pilot Park as a community wellness hub, a welcoming neighborhood space where residents of all ages can access physical activity, nutrition education, mental well-being resources, environmental programming, and opportunities for meaningful social connection.



This open house series marks an important step in guiding the next phase of programming and community engagement at Glen Eden. Community input gathered during these sessions will directly inform future programs, partnerships, accessibility improvements, and long-term planning for the site.



We are building with the community, not for the community. Every idea and perspective shared during these open houses will help guide how Glen Eden evolves into a space that truly reflects neighborhood needs and priorities.



Residents may attend any of the following sessions:



 To register for an open house session, visit Health & Wellness: Glen Eden Pilot Park



What to Expect
Each open house will feature interactive feedback stations, opportunities to speak directly with staff, and light refreshments. Participants will be invited to share input on potential offers, such as:



Residents are welcome to attend in person and/or complete an online survey .



Who Should Attend
All residents are encouraged to participate — including families, active adults, youth, neighborhood groups, community leaders, and potential health and wellness partners. Whether you are a frequent park visitor or new to the space, your voice matters.



Accessibility & Participation
Open houses are free and open to the public. Glen Eden Pilot Park is ADA accessible. Community members are welcome to drop in at any time during the event window. Those unable to attend in person are encouraged to complete the online survey .



What Happens Next
Following the open house series, Raleigh Parks will review and summarize community feedback and share next steps for programming and development during the summer of 2026. Community input will play a key role in shaping Glen Eden’s evolution as a neighborhood-centered wellness destination.



This effort aligns with Raleigh Parks’ broader commitment to advancing health, well-being, and equitable access to recreation opportunities across the city.



For more information or to register for an open house session, visit: Health & Wellness: Glen Eden Pilot Park

item.title: Raleigh Adult Athletics Registration (Feb 16, 2026)
item.description:
Raleigh Parks Athletics is offering adult softball, baseball, and kickball for ages 18 and up. Programs will be offered at various park locations throughout the city. Registration will be held from February 15-28. Interested athletes may register online or at any City of Raleigh community center. Adult leagues register as a team. Individuals who are interested in playing but are not currently part of a team need to contact the Athletics office to be placed on our Free Agent List.



For more information, please call 919-996-6836 or email Athletics@raleighnc.gov.



Registration Dates: Feb. 15-28
Cost: Varies
Ages: 18 and older
Register on RecLink

item.title: Travel With Us: New Active Adult Day Trips Announced (Feb 16, 2026)
item.description:
Join Scott Blackburn, author of It Dies With You as he takes us on a journey to the locations throughout the book. Story takes place in Flint Creek, NC, which is a fictional location, but the places are based on locations in Greensboro and Kernersville, NC. After a postfight brawl jeopardizes his boxing career, Hudson Miller takes a job as a bar bouncer—only to be hit with worse news: his estranged father has been murdered. Upon returning to settle the estate and discovering he’s inheriting his father’s salvage yard. But Miller’s Pull-a-Part hides more than scrap metal. The property was a front for an illegal gun-running operation—and a gruesome discovery there pulls Hudson into a deadly mystery.
- Visit and discover how these locations played a part in the book - AL Lows Boxing Club, Scuppernong Books, Prissy Polly's BBQ.
- Lunch on your own at Captain Tom's Seafood



Time: 8:45 a.m. to 4 p.m.
Cost: $35/Residents $50/Non-residents
Additional Information
Trip Registration



Step into the 40,000-square-foot Billy Graham Library and explore the extraordinary life and legacy of one of the most influential public figures of the 20th century. This unforgettable visit takes you on a journey from Billy Graham’s humble farm beginnings to his role on the world stage as an advisor to presidents, a global traveler, and a voice heard by millions.



Nestled on 20 beautifully landscaped acres in Charlotte, North Carolina, just miles from his childhood home, the barn-shaped library offers a compelling blend of history, personal storytelling, and cultural impact. Journey at your leisure through immersive multimedia exhibits, photographs, and memorabilia, and you’ll gain insight into the life, times, and far-reaching influence of a man who helped shape modern American history.
- Charter motorcoach transportation
- Lunch on your own Dairy Barn
- General Admission Ticket



Time: 8:15 a.m. to 6 p.m.
Cost: $81/Residents $96/Non-residents
Additional Information
Trip Registration



Travel to Sanford, NC, Temple Theatre. Bright Star is a musical about a literary editor and a World War II soldier who discover a secret that changes their lives. The show is set in the American South in the 1920s and 1940s. When Alice Murphy meets a young soldier just home from World War II, he awakens her longing for the child she once lost. Haunted by their unique connection, Alice sets out on a journey to understand her past—and what she finds has the power to transform both of their lives. Lunch on your own downtown Sanford.

Time: 10:30 a.m. to 5 p.m.
Cost: $53/Residents $68/Non-residents
Additional Information
Trip Registration



Visit our website to learn more about our day and multi-day travel opportunities.

item.title: Virtual Public Session on Neuse River Park PARTF Grant Application (Jan 29, 2026)
item.description:
PARTF is North Carolina’s competitive grant program administered by the N.C. Division of Parks and Recreation. It provides matching funds to local governments for acquiring land, building or renovating parks and recreation facilities, and expanding public access to waterways and outdoor recreation. PARTF projects are selected based on public benefit, alignment with local plans, site quality, accessibility, and long‑term stewardship.



Discussion of the cost estimate and final Schematic Design will occur at the March 24 CAG meeting (6 p.m., Raleigh Municipal Building, Room 305). The project will then advance to the Parks Committee on April 2 (6 p.m., Raleigh Municipal Building, Room 305), where elements proposed for funding through Phase One will be finalized. On April 16, 2026, the schematic design will be reviewed by the Parks, Recreation, and Greenway Advisory Board, which will provide a recommendation to the City Council. The project is anticipated to be considered by the City Council in May 2026, at which time the Council will be asked to vote on the schematic design.



Location: Virtual
Date: Tuesday, Feb. 10
Time: 6 p.m.
Ages: All
Cost: Free
Join the Virtual Session

item.title: Ignite Gospel Concert Night (Jan 29, 2026)
item.description:
This unforgettable event brings together some of Gospel's best, headlined by Dr. Kim Person, Contemporary Gospel, Anthony Sutton & Fresh Wind Traditional Choir, Gerald Hinton & Redeemers Quartet harmony, and Marcus Young Hip-Hop Gospel, all under one roof. Hosting this year's Ignite 2026 event will be the one and only hilarious "Let Larrell Testify"!

As we step into 2026, we invite you to renew your spirit and reignite your purpose through an evening filled with incredible music, laughter, praise, and community. Whether you love soulful classics, modern worship, or high-energy Gospel vibes, Ignite 2026 has something for everyone. Come celebrate new beginnings, new hope, and a new fire!

Location: Carolina Pines Park
Date: Saturday, Feb. 28
Time: Doors Open at 3 p.m., Showtime 4 - 6 p.m.
Ages: All
Advanced Tickets: $20
Door Tickets:$25

item.title: Low-Mow Spring (Feb 12, 2026)
item.description:
In our ongoing effort to support native wildflowers and provide vital pollinator habitat and early forage, we’re reducing spring mowing in many of our parks and preserves. With beneficial insect populations in decline, we take our role as stewards of Raleigh’s green spaces seriously. 

This initiative not only conserves resources but also supports local wildlife and enhances the beauty of our parks in a more sustainable way. By allowing select areas of our parks to grow more naturally, we’re creating vibrant, environmentally friendly spaces for everyone to enjoy.

Come mid-April, as the blooms begin to fade, we’ll resume our mowing routine. Until then, enjoy a peaceful Low-Mow Spring, Raleigh — complete with the calming sounds of nature and a break from the hum of power equipment!



To learn more about Raleigh's Pollinator Protection Projects, please visit our website.

item.title: Microsoft Excel Program with Certification Prep (Jan 27, 2026)
item.description:
Get comfortable writing formulas and functions and using graphic elements to represent data visually. Learn how to manage worksheets and workbooks, cells and data ranges, tables, and table data. Perform operations by using formulas and functions. Additionally, summarize data visually by creating, modifying, and formatting charts/sparklines, and prepare workbooks for collaboration and distribution.



Learn Excel and enhance your resume today! Upon completion of this course, you will be prepared for the Microsoft Excel Associate certification exam. The Microsoft Excel Certification exam is not included with this course.

Location: Five Points Center for Active Adults
Date: Tuesdays and Thursdays, Feb. 10 - April 30
Time: 6 - 8 p.m.
Cost: $531 for Resident / $546 for Non-Resident
Ages: 18 and older
Register on RecLink

item.title: Apply for the Counselor In Training Summer Program Today! (Jan 27, 2026)
item.description:
Team building, role-playing, and hands-on application will highlight a week of fun and personal growth. A high level of maturity is a must for participants. Successful applicants will be required to complete one week of training followed by an opportunity to volunteer for one week (40 hours) with one City of Raleigh Parks, Recreation and Cultural Resources Department's summer camps.



Location: Thomas Crowder Woodland Center
Dates: June 15 - 18
Time: 8 a.m. - 5:30 p.m.
Ages: 14-16 (as of June 15, 2026)
Cost: $250
Apply Today to be a Counselor in Training!

item.title: Screenwriting Workshop (Jan 22, 2026)
item.description:
Join our six-week Screenwriting Workshop and learn how to craft a compelling three-act screenplay from start to finish. The workshop runs from Feb. 25 through April 1, meeting on Wednesdays from 5:30 to 6:30 p.m.



In this interactive and supportive environment, participants will learn the fundamentals of screenwriting, develop their own three-act screenplay, and give and receive constructive feedback on their writing. Writers of all experience levels are welcome, from beginners to those looking to strengthen their skills. This is a great opportunity to grow creatively, connect with other writers, and bring your story to life. Please bring a laptop, tablet, or phone.



Location: John P. "Top" Greene African American Cultural Center
Dates: Wednesdays, Feb. 25 - April 1
Time: 5:30 - 6:30 p.m.
Ages: 18 and older
Cost: Free
Register on RecLink

item.title: Gather and Grow with Us at Our Urban Farm Open House (Feb 11, 2026)
item.description:
Operated and supported in partnership with Raleigh City Farm, our Urban Farm was created in 2025 as a way to grow and distribute fresh produce to members of the Raleigh community. 

Take a tour, enjoy some fresh produce, chat with the farmers, learn about volunteer opportunities, and meet your neighbors at this drop-in opportunity to see all things going on with our Urban Farm! 

The official Groundbreaking Ceremony will be held at 6 p.m. Check in at the lobby of Marsh Creek Community Center when you arrive to start your tour experience. This is a rain-or-shine event.

Location: Marsh Creek Community Center
Date: Thursday, March 19
Time: 2 - 7:30 p.m., Groundbreaking Ceremony at 6 p.m.
Ages: All
Cost: Free

item.title: Adventure Awaits: Private Outdoor Group Programs (Feb 11, 2026)
item.description:
Private outdoor adventure programs open in May, offering customizable, hands-on experiences for all ages, from families and scouts to adult and professional groups.



Perfect for birthdays, homeschool days, badge work, or team-building, each program fosters discovery, confidence, and connection. Led by experienced instructors, experiences are flexible, scalable, and can be added to facility rentals. Group discounts (10+) may apply.

item.title: Summer Reservations at the Lake (Feb 10, 2026)
item.description:
Using our reservations portal is the quickest and most sure way to guarantee that you get the shelter you want for your plans out at the Lake!



Location: Lake Wheeler
Shelter Rental Cost: $12 - $30 per hour
Request a Shelter on RecLink

item.title: Teen Museum Market (Feb 3, 2026)
item.description:
Join us for a fun-filled event featuring talented teen vendors, creative arts and crafts, and DIY craft tables. All while enjoying an up-and-coming student band. Of course, we’ll have snacks!



Location: City of Raleigh Museum
Date: Saturday, Feb. 21
Time: 11 a.m. - 2 p.m.
Ages: All
Cost: Free
No Registration is Required

item.title: Annual Heirloom Plant Sale (Feb 3, 2026)
item.description:
Heirloom varieties of plants will be on sale at great prices. All plants are started from seed by the Mordecai Historic Park gardeners. Plants will include tomatoes, peppers, squash, herbs, and much more.



Gardeners will be on hand to answer questions and provide more information about the garden and grounds at Mordecai Historic Park! For questions or more information, please call 919-996-4364.



Location: Mordecai Historic Park
Date: Friday and Saturday, April 24 - 25
Time: 8:30 a.m. - 2 p.m.
Ages: All ages
Cost: $3 - $5 per plant

item.title: Weatherbound Program Open Feb. 3 (Feb 1, 2026)
item.description:
Kids can enjoy a fun, supervised day filled with games, crafts, and active fun.



Cost: $40
Time: 10 a.m. - 6 p.m.
Locations: Abbotts Creek, Brier Creek, and Jaycee
Register now to reserve your spot!

item.title: A Roadmap to Freedom (Jan 29, 2026)
item.description: Local Raleigh attorney Lex-Jordan Ibegbu of Ibegbu Law, PLLC, presents a legal narrative of the realization of African Americans' rights.

item.title: Meet the Bunny at Abbotts Creek (Jan 26, 2026)
item.description:
Participants will have the opportunity to play games and create crafts. After making your way through the crafts and games, stop for a picture with the bunny and pick up a plush egg from the egg patch. Due to the limited number of crafts and prizes, pre-registration is required for each participant.



Date: Tuesday, March 24
Time: 10 - 11:30 a.m.
Ages: 0-6
Cost: Free
Register on RecLink

item.title: Construction to Begin at Green Road Park (Jan 26, 2026)
item.description:
Construction at Green Road Park is scheduled to begin in February, marking a major step forward in the Green Road Park Improvement Project. Construction is expected to continue through early 2027.



During this period, outdoor facilities at Green Road Park will be closed to the public, and all outdoor programs hosted at the park will be suspended or relocated. Despite the closure of outdoor facilities, both the Green Road Community Center and the Green Road Library will remain open and continue serving patrons throughout construction. Parking at the Community Center is expected to be limited due to construction activities.



Improvements include new accessible pathways connecting park features; raised parking lot crosswalks to improve pedestrian safety; entrance plaza with a shade structure; expanded playground area; new restroom building; pickleball courts; electric vehicle charging station installation; stormwater improvements; and landscaping.



More information about the project, including updates and design details, is available on the City’s project page: https://raleighnc.gov/projects/green-road-park
